result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley L. BARFOOT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in these charges, the defendant entered a plea in Case File 16 CF 398.   Court grants the motion. 
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 11-22-2016 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 3.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
The defendant still wishes to represent himself in these matters.
The court has a colloquy with the defendant and goes through his right to counsel.
The Court will allow the defendant to represent himself in these matters.  However, if the matter is not resolved after he meets with the district attorney at the settlement conference, the Court will appoint stand by counsel before proceeding to trial.
The Court allows Attorney Kerscher to withdraw.
Settlement conference with D.A. is set for 10-26-16 at 11:00 a.m.
Pretrial and jury trial have already been scheduled and notice given to defendant.
Minutes.
Plea date on October 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

The defendant wants to fire Attorney Kerscher and represent himself in these matters.
The Court questions the defendant.
The Court will schedule a hearing to determine whether or not the defendant is competent to represent himself.
Hearing is set for 10-11-16 at 10:30 a.m.
Pretrial conference is set for 11-22-16 at 9:30 a.m.
Jury trials are set for 12-07-16 at 8:30 a.m.  #1, #2, #3.
Notices.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 10-07-2016 at 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Plea date on October 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
It is hereby ordered that Jewel Scharenbroch shall be allowed to withdraw as counsel for the defendant above-named. A conflict of interest was discovered.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant failed to appear.  Bench warrant authorized.   
At 10:50 a.m. case recalled.   Defendant in custody.   
Defendant is in the process of getting an attorney.   Plea date reset to 09-08-16 at 10:30 a.m.   
Notice. 
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for plea date.    Bench warrant authorized.  
At 4:11 p.m. case recalled.   Defendant now present.  
Bench warrant cancelled.   Plea date reset to 08-03-16 at 9:30 a.m.   
Notice.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-13-16 at 10:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 07-20-16 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-16 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $450.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, have no entry into any bar or tavern and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
